title.narrative: 007 CAP:PROGRAMME EFFECTIVENESS

description.narrative: Enhanced capacity of staff and partners to communicate and advocate for child rights, which contributes to Communication And Advocacy, Cross-Sectoral - Human Rights, Cross-Sectoral - Other Programme Areas, Operations Support To Programme Delivery, Operations Support To Programme Delivery (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: New ElementBuilding FOs' capacity

mailing-address.narrative: UNICEF House (Kazanchis - Opposite UNECA/German House) P.O. Box 1169 Addis Ababa

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Enhanced capacity of staff and partners to communicate and advocate for child rights

description.narrative: Communication and advocacy focused on highlighting the situation of women and children in Ethiopia and UNICEF’s programmatic response to demonstrate results and for resource mobilization through both a development and humanitarian lens. A strong focus was placed on raising awareness of the humanitarian needs of children impacted by the conflict in northern Ethiopia and to advocate for their protection rights. UNICEF continued to communicate on COVID-19 prevention and mitigation measures and also on the importance and safety of the COVID-19 vaccine to promote uptake. | Status:Met | As-of Date:06/01/2022

baseline.value: Target: 4 articles, 4 radio and TV programmes

actual.value: 2021:4 radio shows and multiple messaging on social media on COVID-19.
